David,

I'd be excited to have it in Germany.  I'd even be willing to do a  
presentation on the work that I've been doing using Cantera.  I would  
also love to hear how others are using it.

Karl

On Nov 30, 2005, at 10:50 AM, David Goodwin wrote:

> At the first Cantera workshop in Chicago in 2004, we said something
> about holding another one in conjunction with the Combustion Symposium
> in Heidelberg in 2006.  Now we need to decide whether to do it or not.
> I'd like to get some sense of how useful people feel a Cantera  
> workshop
> would be, and how many might attend if it were held in Heidelberg on
> Sunday, August 6.
>
> If we do it, I would like much of the workshop to consist of
> contributed talks from Cantera users on what you are doing with  
> Cantera
> in research or teaching.  But of course I could talk about future
> directions for Cantera (or whatever else people are interested in)  
> too.
>
> Another option would be to hold a workshop somewhere else.  This might
> be preferred by non-combustion Cantera users, who wouldn't be in
> Heidelberg. (There's always the "Westin La Cantera" golf resort near
> San Antonio, Texas...)
>
> Let me know what you think, either by posting to the user's group, or
> by sending me an email message.
>
> Thanks,
> Dave
>
